review: Set up is easy.....and working within minutes....especially if you are familiar with Apple products, if not to worry, still pretty easy to use.The only issue is that almost daily my Netflix streaming will be interrupted, which immediately fixed by a quick restartThat's it.....hope this helpsSeveral months later the streaming interruptions seems to have become a chronic issue. I would appreciate some help on how to overcome this problem. I know some people that have no issues with this device whatsoever.....my wireless modem is less than a few inches away from this device.
author: Amazonian

review: I have a Roku and I think this Apple TV has a better user interface for Netflix. It's 52 inches of "eye candy" on my Big HD TV. But what I really like is now I can rip my BluRays with Hand Brake to the Apple TV 3 format, drop them into itunes and now I can watch all my movies through this "hocky puck" sized device. My home theater pc uses around 120 watts of power, while this only sips 1.9 wats. Whats not to like.

author: adeinert

review: Now that I've gotten it to work, I love it as much as I love all my iPhone.  The only thing was when I first got it, it would always freeze or stop working after about 10 minutes.  I drove myself INSANE trying to find a solution.  I was so upset about it!So the solution, if you're like me is that you have to go to your router in any internet broswer by typing in the ip address, log in, and add in the atv's ip address as always allowed.  I don't trully understand why this is, but the explanation is something about devices are constantly "reconnecting" to the router, and this is what disrupts the atv's performance and ruins everything until fixed.  They say modern routers don't do this, but mine is only a few months old, so I think it's a problem with atv that it doesn't work out of the box or at least make it easier to find this solution which it took me HOURS to find.  I hope if you have this problem you find this review sooner.
